Positive: A 65-year-old male presents to the clinic with a 6-month history of palpitations, chest discomfort, and shortness of breath. He reports feeling lightheaded and fatigued. Upon further evaluation, an electrocardiogram reveals an irregular heartbeat consistent with atrial fibrillation. The patient also has a history of hypertension and diabetes.
Negative: A 45-year-old female comes in for a routine check-up with no significant medical history. She denies any palpitations, chest pain, or shortness of breath. Physical exam is unremarkable, and an electrocardiogram shows a normal sinus rhythm with no evidence of atrial fibrillation.
